relation: Port on which link bundling is configured.
Peer’s LACP system identification (sys-id). It is a combination of the system priority and the MAC address of the peer device.
Port number on the peer device
Number of seconds since the last LACP PDU was received on the port.
Defines the ability of a port to aggregate with other ports.
Determines the aggregation capability of the link.
Activity state of the port. See the Port State description in the show lacp internal Field Descriptions table for state variables.

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description evc-name ] { static | dynamic } level-id | evc number | level type domain-name | interface [ domain [ mep | mip ] [ detail ] local maintenance-points cfm ethernet show To display information about local Connectivity Fault Management (CFM) maintenance points that are configured on a device, use the show ethernet cfm maintenance-points local command in privileged EXEC mode. show ethernet cfm maintenance-points local weight (srvs instance) uni count transport ipv4 (PTP) traceroute ethernet vlan traceroute ethernet evc traceroute ethernet tod timer (Ethernet ring) template (eoam) sync interval status peer topology dual-homed status decoupled source template (eoam) snmp-server host traps evc snmp-server enable traps ether-oam snmp-server enable traps ethernet evc snmp-server enable traps ethernet cfm crosscheck snmp-server enable traps ethernet cfm cc snmp-server enable traps ethernet cfm alarm shutdown (bridge-domain) show ptp port dataset port show
textAfterTable: evc-name (Optional) Identifier foe an EVC. The evc-name argument is not supported in Cisco IOS Release 12.2(54)SE and Cisco IOS Release12.2(50)SY. static (Optional) Indicates configuration through the CLI. dynamic (Optional) Indicates configuration through a dynamic session or an accounting, authentication, and authorization (AAA) server. Command Default When none of the optional keywords and arguments is specified, information about all the maintenance points on the device is shown. Command Modes Privileged EXEC (#) Command History Release Modification 12.2(33)SRA This command was introduced. 12.4(11)T This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release
